meanings.definition: To bargain or negotiate over a price
meanings.sent1: She haggled with the seller to lower the price of the dress.
meanings.sent2: The customers haggled with the vendor at the market for a better deal.
meanings.sent3: The siblings haggled playfully over who would get the last cookie.
meanings.sent4: The two countries haggled over the terms of the trade agreement.
meanings.sent5: The farmer haggled with the supplier to get a fair price for the seeds.

meanings.sent1: They haggled over which movie to watch on movie night.
meanings.sent2: The siblings haggled about whose turn it was to do the dishes.
meanings.sent3: The friends haggled good-naturedly over who would pay for dinner.
meanings.sent4: The neighbors haggled over the property line for months.
meanings.sent5: The team haggled over the best strategy to win the game.

meanings.definition: To wrangle or quibble over small details
meanings.sent1: The group haggled over the color of the logo for hours.
meanings.sent2: The committee haggled about the wording of the proposal.
meanings.sent3: The students haggled over the font size for the project poster.
meanings.sent4: The team haggled over the schedule for the upcoming event.
meanings.sent5: The couple haggled over the decorations for their wedding.
